segment.tokens: A soldier of the Royal African Corps did not escape
as Mr. Moodie did
for an elephant caught him with his trunk
an elephant carried him some distance
an elephant threw him down
an elephant brought his four feet together
an elephant trod upon him
stamped
till he was
He left the body
then returned to it
knelt down
upon
crushed
kneaded it once more
then he seized it with his trunk
he bore it to the jungle
he threw it among the bushes
One of the strongest instincts of the elephant is to try the strength of everything
before he ventures upon it
it is almost to induce him to trust himself upon any surface which is not perfectly firm and steady
any surface is not perfectly steady
Therefore the well-authenticated story is the more extraordinary of a rope-dancing rather walking
not only walked forwards
backwards upon a suspended rope
suspended
being brought to the Adelphi
A female elephant seven years old first ascertained the safety of the stage
A female elephant seven years old then began to rehearse the parts
she used to play in Paris
Having succeeded so well in this place
she took a higher walk of performances at the Coburg theatre
where she rehearsed for three weeks
she then distinguished the actors
learnt to place the crown on the head of the lawful king
she feasted at his banquet with perfect propriety
All this was taught her kindness
A poor little calf elephant hovered about the body of its mother after she had been killed
she had been killed
making the most mournful noises
the herd had deserted them
they had passed the night in the forest
The poor thing when the hunters came up
The poor thing entwined its little proboscis about their legs
The poor thing showed its delight at their approach by many ungainly antics
The poor thing then went to the body of its mother
scaring away the vultures
The poor thing ran
round it with every mark of grief
The poor thing tried to raise it with its trunk
Of course the confidence of the baby elephant was not abused
though its wishes for aid towards its mother could not be gratified
The elephants of Ceylon have always been reckoned the best
instances of their memory are quite
when they were of the island
A favourite mode of execution among the Canadians was to make the elephants trample upon the criminals so as to crush their limbs first
avoiding the vital parts prolong their agony
When Mr. Sirr was there
he saw one of these elephant executioners
The word of command " Slay the wretch "
was given to him
which he raised his trunk
he pretended to twist
it round a body
he then slowly raised one of his fore feet
he placed it
where the limbs of the victim would have been
then he stood motionless with his trunk in the air
He was ordered to complete his work
he placed one foot as on the man 's abdomen , and another on his head with apparently sufficient force to destroy life
The elephant had not done this for thirty-five years
The elephant recollected the whole
They attain a great age
They have been known to live more than a hundred years
Major Rogers had killed one thousand four hundred elephants
Major Rogers shot one
whom the ball only made a flesh wound
the creature in a fury uttered its trumpet-like shriek in two places , and several of his ribs
seized the Major with his trunk
carried him to a deep hole
dashed him into it
trampled upon him
breaking his right arm
He must have been killed
if the hole had been enough to give the elephant room to exercise his whole strength
He became senseless
when he came to himself
but found the elephant friends about him
gone
he knew
what had happened
he said
he had always made up his mind of such an accident to remain quite passive affording the best chance of escape
his plan answered
done to elephants way of insult
Nothing teasing unkindness is ever forgotten them
Nothing forgiven
they are to take an opportunity revenging themselves
On the other hand kindness is equally remembered
kindness appreciated
an awkward proof which occurred to a lady , who , when she frequently went to see a male elephant , carried to him bread , apples , and brandy
when she frequently went to see a male elephant
a lady carried to him bread apples brandy
To show his gratitude for these he took her up with his trunk one day
he seated her on his back
As she could not enjoy this testimonial of his feelings
she uttered the most piercing shrieks
she implored the assistance of those around
around
His keepers however advised her not to stir
there she was obliged to wait
till he again encircled her with his trunk
he put her on the ground in safety
Of the attachment of elephants to each other a proof was given two in the Jardin des Plantes , who had been with difficulty separated during their journey thither from Holland
the Jardin des Plantes had been with difficulty separated during their journey thither from Holland
separated during their journey thither from Holland
They were placed in two apartments , divided by a portcullis
divided a portcullis
The male soon found out
that this was fastened only a perpendicular bolt
a perpendicular bolt he soon raised
this then rushed into the other room
The joy of the two at meeting can scarcely be described
their cries of joy shook the whole building
they blew air from their trunks
resembling the blasts from smiths ' bellows
The female moved her ears with great rapidity
The female entwined her trunk round the body of the male
she kept the end motionless for a long time close to his ear , and after holding it again round his body , applied it to her own mouth
it again round his body
applied it to her own mouth
The male encircled her with his trunk
The male shed tears
They were afterwards kept in the same apartment
and their attachment was never interrupted
